sentences.en: As a schoolboy, he showed every sign of genius.
sentences.cn: 当他还是个小学生的时候, 就显示出了天资聪慧.

sentences.en: At the time, his appointment seemed a stroke of genius.
sentences.cn: 当时，对他的任命犹如神来之笔。

sentences.en: Dick thinks of himself as a genius in literature.
sentences.cn: 迪克自以为是个文学天才.

sentences.en: He has been variously described as a hero, a genius and a bully.
sentences.cn: 他被描述为英雄、天才、恶霸，不一而足。

sentences.en: He railed at the world for its neglect of his genius.
sentences.cn: 他怨世人不能赏识他的才华.

sentences.en: He's a real genius but he has difficulty verbalizing his ideas.
sentences.cn: 他确实是个天才，可是难以用语言表达他的思想。

sentences.en: His genius alone has mastered every crisis.
sentences.cn: 仅凭天分，他就控制了所有的危机。

sentences.en: His genius was not confined to the decoration of buildings.
sentences.cn: 他的天赋不单体现在建筑物的装饰上。

sentences.en: I think he's a true genius.
sentences.cn: 我认为他是个真正的天才。

sentences.en: Linus Pauling is an unconventional genius.
sentences.cn: 莱纳斯·鲍林是个标新立异的天才人物。

sentences.en: Often a genius is recognized only after he is dead and gone.
sentences.cn: 天才往往在离开人世之后才得到认可。

sentences.en: She blathers about goodness and beauty and her own genius.
sentences.cn: 她胡吹什么德行、美貌和自己的天才.

sentences.en: The boy was touched with genius.

sentences.cn: 这部影片展现了费里尼的天赋。

sentences.en: The musical Establishment think he is a musical genius.
sentences.cn: 音乐界权威人士认为他是个音乐天才.

phrases.tran_cn: 一个地方的风气或特色；一个地方的守护神

trans.tran_cn: 天才，天赋，天才人物，（特别的）才能
trans.tran_en: a very high level of intelligence, mental skill, or ability, which only a few people have
